job.title: Associate Data Engineer
job.description: ltpgtltstronggtJob DescriptionltstronggtltpgtltpgtltstronggtampnbspltstronggtltpgtltpgtAs anltstronggt Associate Data Engineerampnbspltstronggtyou will be successful if you excel at designing and building reporting and analytic solutions from complex and dynamic benefits administration data You will support other Technology and Product Team members along with team members from the Customer Success departments to analyze patterns visualize data in effective ways and support client data requests You have a natural curiosity to hypothesize and have the desire and ability to be a gogetter and try to look for the answers in data in different ways You are not satisfied understanding the issues instead preferring to take action communicate your recommendations effectively and drive change using data Working in a fastpaced environment managing through uncertainty and networking across Vimly teams to weave the right data picture are challenges that energize you If you are drawn to the opportunity to reimagine benefits administration and deliver innovation come join usltpgtltpgtltstronggtampnbspltstronggtltpgtltpgtltstronggtJob ResponsibilitiesltstronggtltpgtltulgtltligtEnable and support other Vimly team members by developing powerful and insightful reporting that will help guide the businessltligtltligtIntegrate bringing a DevOps mindsetltligtltligtAble to fully complete tasks that are generally a smaller feature or piece of the systemltligtltligtSelfstarter and able to work under the guidance of more senior team membersltligtltligtWork closely with other members of the Vimly team to create adhoc reports to support timely business decisions service evaluation and any project workltligtltligtAbility to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear precise and actionableltligtltligtExcel at making complex concepts simple and easy to understand by those around youltligtltligtParticipate in stakeholder meetings and present data insights to usersclientsexecutives in a succinct and effective wayltligtltligtDemonstrate an understanding of and commitment to Vimlys core values continuous learning innovation adaptability and resilience with all members of Vimlys staff and clientsltligtltligtAcquireampnbspdata from primary or secondary data sources and create meaningful understanding for internal and external customersltligtltligtExtract Transform and Load ETL customer dataltligtltligtHighly organizedltligtltligtTeam player with strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build environment with a lot of ambiguity and constant changeltligtltligtAbility to champion quality throughout the organizationltligtltulgtltpgtltstronggtampnbspltstronggtltpgtltpgtltstronggtMinimum Qualificationsltstronggtltpgtltulgtltligtampnbsp1 year of experience with data stores such as MySQL Postgresql or similarltligtltligtBachelors Degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience preferredltligtltligt1 year software development experience programming with at least one of the following languages Net or Javaltligtltligtampnbsp1 year of experience with data stores such as MySQL of scalable resilient performant applications and APIsltligtltligtAbility to work with and lead teams of stakeholders with differing backgrounds and job highquality deliveryltligtltligtManages the workload  makes timely decisions prioritizes effectively solves problems monitors results and takes remedial action where necessary Ability to learn new teamoriented environmentampnbspampnbspltligtltulgtltpgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtltemgtThis position may be performed remotely anywhere within the United States except the State of Coloradoltemgtltpgt
